dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Acidity-Alkalinity
name: Acidity-Alkalinity

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Acidity-Alkalinity, TSP
name: Acidity-Alkalinity, TSP

dct:description: 'Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol absorption coefficient: AAOD = exp(-K.Îz) where K is the absorption coefficient [km-1] and Îz the vertical path [km]'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol Absorption Optical Depth
name: Aerosol Absorption Optical Depth

dct:description: 'Spectral volumetric extinction cross-section of aerosol particles.'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
name: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient

dct:description: '2D field of the column burden of condensed particles in the atmosphere'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol column burden (mass density)
name: Aerosol column burden (mass density)

dct:description: 'Height of vertically localized aerosol layer above sea level'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol layer height
name: Aerosol layer height

dct:description: 'The AOD is the effective depth of the aerosol over a specified distance, from the viewpoint of radiation propagation: Vertical integral of spectral aerosol extinction coefficient AOD = exp(-K. Îz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ] and Îz the vertical path [km].'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol optical depth, TSP
name: Aerosol optical depth, TSP

dct:description: 'Selection, out of a pre-defined set of aerosol classes, that best fits an input data set (observed or modeled). The pre-defined set of aerosol classes includes specification of the particle composition, mixing state, complex refractive index, and shape as a function of particle size. The definition of aerosol type includes specification of all the classes as well as the algorithm used to choose the best fit to the input data.'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol type
name: Aerosol type

dct:description: 'Field of total column mass of volcanic ash'@en
rdfs:label: Aerosol volcanic ash (Total column)
name: Aerosol volcanic ash (Total column)

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Air temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)
name: Air temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)

dct:description: 'Density of the atmosphere.'@en
rdfs:label: Atmospheric density
name: Atmospheric density

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Atmospheric pressure
name: Atmospheric pressure

dct:description: 'The product of the total volume backscatter coefficient and the atmospheric two-way transmission of the layers between the instrument and the observed volume. The total volume backscatter coefficient is the sum of all backscatter coefficients from the atmosphere (including from molecules and particles) accounting for all polarizations. The atmospheric two-way transmission accounts for the total volume (molecular and particulate and all polarizations) extinction along the path from the instrument to the observed volume and back.'@en
rdfs:label: Attenuated backscatter
name: Attenuated backscatter

dct:description: 'Luminous flux received from the background per unit solid angle and per unit area. Note: Luminous flux is a quantity derived from radiant flux by evaluating the radiation according to its action upon the International Commission on Illumination standard photometric observer.'@en
rdfs:label: Background luminance
name: Background luminance

dct:description: 'The angle through which an electromagnetic wave is refracted when passing along an atmospheric path, used particularly for GNSS radio occultation observations.'@en
rdfs:label: Bending angle
name: Bending angle

dct:description: 'Also called radiance temperature or equivalent black body temperature. The temperature of a black body emitting the spectral radiance equivalent to the observed spectral radiance at the observed frequency or wavelength.'@en
rdfs:label: Brightness temperature
name: Brightness temperature

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: CCN concentration at single supersaturation
name: CCN concentration at single supersaturation

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: CCN concentration spectra
name: CCN concentration spectra

dct:description: 'The pressure characteristic is an indication of how the pressure has changed during that period of time, for example, decreasing then increasing, or increasing and then increasing more rapidly.'@en
rdfs:label: Characteristic of pressure tendency
name: Characteristic of pressure tendency

dct:description: 'Fraction of the sky covered by clouds of a particular type or combination. It can refer to a genus, species, variety, layer, or a certain combination of clouds. Also, see \'cloud cover\'.'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud amount
name: Cloud amount

dct:description: 'For surface observations, height of the cloud base above ground level; for aircraft observations, altitude of the cloud base above mean sea level.'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud base height
name: Cloud base height

dct:description: 'The amount of sky estimated to be covered by a specified cloud type (partial cloud amount), or by all cloud types (total cloud amount). In either case, the estimate is made to the nearest okta (eighth) and is reported on a scale which is essentially one of the nearest eighth, except that figures 0 and 8 on the scale signify a completely clear and cloudy sky, respectively, with consequent adjustment to the adjacent 1 and 7 okta intervals.'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud cover
name: Cloud cover

dct:description: 'Atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not).'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud ice
name: Cloud ice

dct:description: 'Atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud liquid water (CLW)
name: Cloud liquid water (CLW)

dct:description: 'Effective depth (thickness) of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation propagation. Specifically, OD = exp(-K.Îz), where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1] and Îz the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud. The WMO Cloud Atlas (https://cloudatlas.wmo.int/en/optical-thickness.html) defines cloud optical thickness as \'The optical thickness of a cloud is the degree to which the cloud prevents light from passing through it.\''@en
rdfs:label: Cloud optical depth
name: Cloud optical depth

dct:description: 'Height of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds) above mean sea level.'@en
rdfs:label: Cloud top height
name: Cloud top height

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Dew-point temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)
name: Dew-point temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)

dct:description: 'Flux density of diffuse short-wave solar radiation, at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Diffuse downward short-wave irradiance
name: Diffuse downward short-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Flux density of direct downwelling short-wave solar radiation, at the top of the atmosphere or at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Direct downward short-wave irradiance
name: Direct downward short-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Flux density of downwelling long-wave radiation, at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Downward long-wave irradiance
name: Downward long-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Flux density of downwelling short-wave solar radiation, at the top of the atmosphere or a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface. [The term \'global (downward) shortwave irradiance\' is sometimes used to specify that this flux is the sum of direct and diffuse components.]'@en
rdfs:label: Downward short-wave irradiance
name: Downward short-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Downward radiant power per area unit, per solid angle, and per wavelength or wavenumber interval.'@en
rdfs:label: Downward spectral radiance
name: Downward spectral radiance

dct:description: 'Concentration of dust or sand in the atmosphere'@en
rdfs:label: Dust mass concentration
name: Dust mass concentration

dct:description: 'Emissivity of the Earth surface as a function of wavelength and viewing angle.'@en
rdfs:label: Earth surface emissivity
name: Earth surface emissivity

dct:description: 'Reflectance of the Earth surface as a function of the viewing angle and the illumination angle averaged over the range 0.4-0.7 Âµm.'@en
rdfs:label: Earth surface short-wave bidirectional reflectance
name: Earth surface short-wave bidirectional reflectance

dct:description: 'Reflectance of the Earth surface as a function of viewing angle, incidence angle and wavelength, spectrally resolved. [The distribution of this variable is represented by the Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF)].'@en
rdfs:label: Earth surface spectral bidirectional reflectance
name: Earth surface spectral bidirectional reflectance

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Electric conductivity
name: Electric conductivity

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Extinction coefficient
name: Extinction coefficient

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Extreme temperature (min, max) (at specified distance from reference surface)
name: Extreme temperature (min, max) (at specified distance from reference surface)

dct:description: 'Height of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other'@en
rdfs:label: Freezing level height in clouds
name: Freezing level height in clouds

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Gust Speed
name: Gust Speed

dct:description: 'Height of a stable layer of air with an increased temperature.'@en
rdfs:label: Height of inversion
name: Height of inversion

dct:description: 'Height of the surface above ground separating the planetary boundary layer (PBL) from the free atmosphere.'@en
rdfs:label: Height of the top of the PBL
name: Height of the top of the PBL

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hydrogen ion (H+) or pH
name: Hydrogen ion (H+) or pH

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hydrometeor radius
name: Hydrometeor radius

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hydrometeor type
name: Hydrometeor type

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, 110 Î¼m equivalent
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, 110 Î¼m equivalent

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, 165 Î¼m equivalent
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, 165 Î¼m equivalent

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, 35 Î¼m equivalent
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, 35 Î¼m equivalent

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, 50 Î¼m equivalent
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, 50 Î¼m equivalent

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, 75 Î¼m equivalent
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, 75 Î¼m equivalent

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Hygroscopic growth factor, total aerosol
name: Hygroscopic growth factor, total aerosol

dct:description: '3D field of super-cooled liquid water, enabling the formation of ice coating on an object.'@en
rdfs:label: Icing potential
name: Icing potential

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Lightning density cloud-to-ground
name: Lightning density cloud-to-ground

dct:description: 'Current incurred by the lightning discharge.'@en
rdfs:label: Lightning discharge current
name: Lightning discharge current

dct:description: 'Polarity of the charge effectively lowered to ground during a lightning discharge.'@en
rdfs:label: Lightning discharge polarity
name: Lightning discharge polarity

dct:description: 'Number of lightning discharges per unit time in a given region (e.g. world-wide) or for a given storm system (e.g. a thunderstorm cell).'@en
rdfs:label: Lightning discharge rate
name: Lightning discharge rate

dct:description: 'Lightning discharge type, defined by the path of the lightning discharge: between two clouds or within the same cloud (intra-cloud) or between cloud and ground (cloud-to-ground).'@en
rdfs:label: Lightning discharge type (cloud to cloud, cloud to surface)
name: Lightning discharge type (cloud to cloud, cloud to surface)

dct:description: 'Number of detected cloud-to-ground flashes in the corresponding time interval and space unit.'@en
rdfs:label: Lightning flash density cloud-to-ground
name: Lightning flash density cloud-to-ground

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Lithometeor type
name: Lithometeor type

dct:description: 'Emissivity of the earth surface integrated over the thermal IR wavelength range and integrated hemispherically.'@en
rdfs:label: Long-wave earth surface emissivity
name: Long-wave earth surface emissivity

dct:description: 'Flux density of long-wave radiation (direction unspecified) at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface. Long-wave radiation is the radiation at wavelengths greater than 3 Î¼m (3000 nm), including most of the spectrum emitted by sources at terrestrial temperatures.'@en
rdfs:label: Long-wave irradiance (direction unspecified)
name: Long-wave irradiance (direction unspecified)

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Mass mixing ratio
name: Mass mixing ratio

dct:description: 'Depth of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other.'@en
rdfs:label: Melting layer depth in clouds
name: Melting layer depth in clouds

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Meteorological Optical Range
name: Meteorological Optical Range

dct:description: 'Height above the surface to which atmospheric properties (wind speed, etc) or atmospheric constituents (aerosol, gases) are dispersed by turbulent vertical mixing'@en
rdfs:label: Mixed layer height
name: Mixed layer height

dct:description: 'Flux density of upwelling long-wave radiation, as the difference between downwelling and upwelling radiation (positive for net downward) at a specified level within or at the top of the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Net long-wave irradiance
name: Net long-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Flux density of short-wave solar radiation, as the difference between downwelling and upwelling radiation (positive for net downward), at the top of the atmosphere or at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Net short-wave irradiance
name: Net short-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Atmospheric O2/N2 ratio'@en
rdfs:label: O2/N2 ratio
name: O2/N2 ratio

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Obscuration type
name: Obscuration type

dct:description: 'The degree to which fog prevents light from passing through it. The term \'fog\' refers to \'microscopic droplets [that] reduce horizontal visibility at the Earthâs surface to less than 1 km\' [WMO, International Cloud Atlas, 2017 ed., https://cloudatlas.wmo.int/en/fog-compared-with-mist.html].'@en
rdfs:label: Optical depth of fog
name: Optical depth of fog

dct:description: 'A part of cloud optical depth which results from a vertical integral of light extinction by cloud particles between the bottom and top of a cloud layer.'@en
rdfs:label: Optical depth within a cloud layer
name: Optical depth within a cloud layer

dct:description: 'Polar Stratospheric Clouds occurrence. - Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [HR] and False Alarm Rate [FAR]. Simplified: [FAR/HR]'@en
rdfs:label: PSC occurrence
name: PSC occurrence

dct:description: 'The area weighted mean radius of the aerosol particles.'@en
rdfs:label: Particle effective radius
name: Particle effective radius

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: PM1'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light absorption coefficient, PM1
name: Particle light absorption coefficient, PM1

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: PM10'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light absorption coefficient, PM10
name: Particle light absorption coefficient, PM10

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: TSP'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light absorption coefficient, TSP
name: Particle light absorption coefficient, TSP

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: PM1'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light scattering coefficient, PM1
name: Particle light scattering coefficient, PM1

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: PM10'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light scattering coefficient, PM10
name: Particle light scattering coefficient, PM10

dct:description: 'A measure of light attenuation due to absorption by aerosol particles expressed as the Beer-Lambert Law exponent at unit path distance. Size range: TSP'@en
rdfs:label: Particle light scattering coefficient, TSP
name: Particle light scattering coefficient, TSP

dct:description: 'Mass of particles per unit volume of air, size fractionated'@en
rdfs:label: Particle mass concentration (size fractionated)
name: Particle mass concentration (size fractionated)

dct:description: 'Mass of particles per unit volume of air, size range: PM1'@en
rdfs:label: Particle mass concentration, PM1
name: Particle mass concentration, PM1

dct:description: 'Mass of particles per unit volume of air, size range: PM10'@en
rdfs:label: Particle mass concentration, PM10
name: Particle mass concentration, PM10

dct:description: 'Mass of particles per unit volume of air, size range: PM2.5'@en
rdfs:label: Particle mass concentration, PM2.5
name: Particle mass concentration, PM2.5

dct:description: 'Mass of particles per unit volume of air, size range: TSP'@en
rdfs:label: Particle mass concentration, TSP
name: Particle mass concentration, TSP

dct:description: 'Amount of particles per unit volume of air'@en
rdfs:label: Particle number concentration
name: Particle number concentration

dct:description: 'Particle number concentration as a function of size, typically equivalent spherical radius or diameter. Size range: TSP'@en
rdfs:label: Particle number size distribution, PM10
name: Particle number size distribution, PM10

dct:description: 'Particle number concentration as a function of size, typically equivalent spherical radius or diameter. Size range: PM10'@en
rdfs:label: Particle number size distribution, TSP
name: Particle number size distribution, TSP

dct:description: 'Pressure tendency is the character and amount of atmospheric pressure change for a three-hour or other specified period ending at the time of observation. Pressure tendency is composed of two parts, namely the characteristic of pressure tendency and amount of pressure tendency.'@en
rdfs:label: Pressure tendency
name: Pressure tendency

dct:description: 'Normalised radar cross section (NRCS) backscatter coefficient, also called sigma-0 (\'sigma-nought\'). The normalised measure of the radar return, measured in dB.'@en
rdfs:label: Radar backscatter coefficient
name: Radar backscatter coefficient

dct:description: 'The radiant flux emitted, reflected, transmitted or received by a given surface, per unit solid angle per unit projected area. It is a directional quantity. Note: Historically, radiance was called \'intensity\'.'@en
rdfs:label: Radiance
name: Radiance

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Rate of ice accretion
name: Rate of ice accretion

dct:description: 'The refractive index (of air) minus one. Particularly used for GNSS radio occultation observations.'@en
rdfs:label: Refractivity
name: Refractivity

dct:description: 'The product of the total volume backscatter coefficient and the atmospheric two-way transmission of the layers between the instrument and the observed volume presented in arbitrary units. The total volume backscatter coefficient is the sum of all backscatter coefficients from the atmosphere (including from molecules and particles) accounting for all polarizations. The atmospheric two-way transmission accounts for the total volume (molecular and particulate and all polarizations) extinction along the path from the instrument to the observed volume and back. The value of this variable in presented in relative, arbitrary units to account for observations of attenuated backscatter lacking final absolute calibrations.'@en
rdfs:label: Relative attenuated backscatter
name: Relative attenuated backscatter

dct:description: 'The ratio of the amount fraction of the water vapour in the air to the corresponding amount fraction if the air were saturated with respect to water at a particular pressure and temperature. Relative humidity is typically reported in percent (%). [Based on definition of R1490 in International Vocabulary of Meteorology (WMO-No. 182). 1992.]'@en
rdfs:label: Relative humidity (with respect to water)
name: Relative humidity (with respect to water)

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Runway visual range
name: Runway visual range

dct:description: 'Flux density of short-wave radiation (direction unspecified) at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface. Short-wave radiation includes most of the solar radiation spectrum in the atmosphere from 280 nm to 3000 nm (3 Î¼m).'@en
rdfs:label: Short-wave irradiance (direction unspecified)
name: Short-wave irradiance (direction unspecified)

dct:description: 'Spectrally resolved flux density of radiation received from the sun at the top of the atmosphere.'@en
rdfs:label: Solar spectral irradiance
name: Solar spectral irradiance

dct:description: 'Spectrally integrated flux density of radiation received from the sun at the top of the atmosphere. Also called \'Total solar irradiance (TSI)\'.'@en
rdfs:label: Solar total irradiance
name: Solar total irradiance

dct:description: 'The ratio of the mass of water vapour in the air to the mass of a moist air parcel, where the mass of the moist air parcel is the sum of the mass of water vapour and the dry air. Synonym: Moisture content. [Based on definition of M1750 in International Vocabulary of Meteorology (WMO-No. 182). 1992.]'@en
rdfs:label: Specific humidity
name: Specific humidity

dct:description: 'Ratio of reflected to incident radiation as a function of incident angle, reflected angle and wavelength. For a satellite measurement, these angles are the zenith and azimuth angles of the sun and the zenith and azimuth angle of the viewing instrument at the feature (surface and/or atmospheric column) being observed.'@en
rdfs:label: Spectral bidirectional reflectance
name: Spectral bidirectional reflectance

dct:description: 'The radiance of a surface per unit frequency or wavelength, depending on whether the spectrum is taken as a function of frequency or of wavelength. It is a directional quantity. Note: \'spectral radiance\' is also used for measurements by radiometers and spectrometers, where it means the spectral radiance incident on the instrument integrated over the normalised spectral response function of the instrument. Historically, spectral radiance was called spectral intensity.'@en
rdfs:label: Spectral radiance
name: Spectral radiance

dct:description: 'The total time in one day during which the direct solar irradiance is equal to or more than the threshold value for bright sunshine (the threshold being 120 W m-2 of direct solar irradiance).'@en
rdfs:label: Sunshine duration
name: Sunshine duration

dct:description: 'Hemispherically integrated reflectance of the Earth surface in the range 0.4-0.7 Âµm.'@en
rdfs:label: Surface albedo
name: Surface albedo

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Temperature
name: Temperature

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Total lightning density
name: Total lightning density

dct:description: 'Total number of detected flashes in the corresponding time interval and space unit. Note: The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle.'@en
rdfs:label: Total lightning flash density
name: Total lightning flash density

dct:description: 'Result of cloud type classification - Accuracy expressed as inverse of number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.'@en
rdfs:label: Type of cloud
name: Type of cloud

dct:description: 'Type of clouds of genera Cirrus, Cirrocumulus, or Cirrostratus. These occur between 3-8 km (polar regions), 5-13 km (temperate regions) and 6-18 km (tropics) above ground [ref: WMO, International Cloud Atlas, 2017 ed.]'@en
rdfs:label: Type of high clouds
name: Type of high clouds

dct:description: 'Type of clouds of genera Stratus, Stratocumulus, Cumulus, or Cumulonimbus. These occur between 0-2 km above ground [ref: WMO, International Cloud Atlas, 2017 ed.]'@en
rdfs:label: Type of low clouds
name: Type of low clouds

dct:description: 'Type of clouds of genera Altocumulus, Altostratus, or Nimbostratus. These occur between 2-4 km (polar regions), 2-7 km (temperate regions) and 2-8 km (tropics) above ground [ref: WMO, International Cloud Atlas, 2017 ed.]'@en
rdfs:label: Type of middle clouds
name: Type of middle clouds

dct:description: 'Spectrally integrated UV radiation'@en
rdfs:label: UV Broadband radiation
name: UV Broadband radiation

dct:description: 'Radiation effective in causing actinic erythema'@en
rdfs:label: UV Erythemal radiation
name: UV Erythemal radiation

dct:description: 'UV radiation measured across several discrete, narrow wavebands (e.g. 10 nm) within the UV range, providing coarse spectral information'@en
rdfs:label: UV Multiband radiation
name: UV Multiband radiation

dct:description: 'UV radiation measured at a higher spectral resolution (e.g. 1 nm) than multiband UV radiation'@en
rdfs:label: UV Spectral radiation
name: UV Spectral radiation

dct:description: 'Horizontal component of wind as a vector in an orthogonal coordinate system.'@en
rdfs:label: Upper wind (X, Y components, horizontal)
name: Upper wind (X, Y components, horizontal)

dct:description: 'Flux density of upwelling long-wave radiation, at the top of the atmosphere or at a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Upward long-wave irradiance
name: Upward long-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Flux density of upwelling short-wave radiation, at the top of the atmosphere or a specified level within the atmosphere, including the Earth surface.'@en
rdfs:label: Upward short-wave irradiance
name: Upward short-wave irradiance

dct:description: 'Upward radiant power per area unit, per solid angle, and per wavelength or wavenumber interval.'@en
rdfs:label: Upward spectral radiance
name: Upward spectral radiance

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Visibility
name: Visibility

dct:description: '3D field of mass mixing ratio of volcanic ash'@en
rdfs:label: Volcanic ash particle mass concentration
name: Volcanic ash particle mass concentration

dct:description: ''@en
rdfs:label: Water vapour pressure
name: Water vapour pressure

dct:description: 'East-west component of the horizontal wind vector, positive value for eastward moving or west-to-east wind. This scalar quantity can be used to represent a value at given location and an instantaneous time or average over spatio-temporal extent or values as a function of spatio-temporal coordinates.'@en
rdfs:label: u (u component of horizontal wind vector)
Property: u (u component of horizontal wind vector)
name: u (u component of horizontal wind vector)

dct:description: 'North-south component of the horizontal wind vector, positive value for northward moving or south-to-north wind. This scalar quantity can be used to represent a value at given location and an instantaneous time or average over spatio-temporal extent or values as a function of spatio-temporal coordinates.'@en
rdfs:label: v (v component of horizontal wind vector)
Property: v (v component of horizontal wind vector)
name: v (v component of horizontal wind vector)

dct:description: 'Vertical component of the 3-D wind vector. positive value for upward wind. This scalar quantity can be used to represent a value at given location and an instantaneous time or average over spatio-temporal extent or values as a function of spatio-temporal coordinates.'@en
rdfs:label: w (vertical component of wind vector)
name: w (vertical component of wind vector)
